label: Adventure Slip
description: Co-op and online multiplayer currency used in the Social / Wandering Paths shop for cosmetics and housing-style rewards. Earned from Wandering Paths runs, co-op bounties, and other online activities; has a weekly cap.
ui_usage_notes: Use whenever referencing co-op / Wandering Paths rewards, social shop cosmetics, or weekly multiplayer checklists.

label: Coin
description: Generic in-game money (Zhou Coin and regional variants) used for most merchant purchases, fees, and basic services. Lives in the Money Bag tab.
ui_usage_notes: Use as the default money icon for generic costs, vendor purchases, repairs, or other non-premium spending.

label: Commerce Coin
description: Mini-game and street-vendor currency used for wagers in activities like Pitch Pot, cards, Mahjong, and for buying street food.
ui_usage_notes: Use when a guide or timer refers specifically to mini-game wagers or street food purchases instead of general merchants.

label: Echo Bead
description: Top-tier premium currency bought with real money. Used to buy Lingering Melodies, cash-shop bundles, cosmetics, and other high-end items.
ui_usage_notes: Use for anything that clearly spends real-money premium currency; do not use for free-to-play only paths.

label: Echo Jade
description: High-value earnable premium-like currency used at special merchants and systems. Commonly spent on Resonating Melodies, Inner Way materials, and other power-progression items.
ui_usage_notes: Use when describing where to spend Echo Jade efficiently (Resonating Melodies, Inner Ways, etc.) or when labelling Echo Jade sinks in checklists.

label: Essence of Earth
description: Draw-shop token obtained from Solemn Echo (standard/free) gacha pulls. Spent in the Draw Shop on rewards associated with the Solemn Echo banner.
ui_usage_notes: Use when a reward comes specifically from the Solemn Echo pool and is purchased via the draw-shop exchange.

label: Essence of Heaven
description: Draw-shop token obtained from Celestial Echo (premium) gacha pulls. Used to purchase rewards in the Draw Shop and can be converted towards Harmonic Cores.
ui_usage_notes: Use on guides that talk about Celestial Echo pity, draw-shop exchanges, or Harmonic Core conversion paths.

label: Fourfold Coin
description: Bounty-shop currency earned from NPC and player bounties. Has a weekly cap and is spent in the Bounty Shop on cosmetics, materials, and some account progression.
ui_usage_notes: Use on bounty-related checklist items or when explaining what to buy from the Bounty Shop each week.

label: Harmonic Core
description: Legendary-tier draw currency from Celestial Echo pulls. Used in the Draw Shop for top-end cosmetics, visual effects, and other rare items. Can often be exchanged into Sound Jade.
ui_usage_notes: Use when explaining long-term premium progression, legendary skill effects, or apex draw-shop purchases.

label: Harmony Charm
description: Social / co-op currency (also called Harmony Coins or Private Funds of the Ward) with a weekly cap. Earned from co-op play, online mode, partnerships, and quiz-style activities; spent in Brotherhood / Social shops on cosmetics and housing items.
ui_usage_notes: Use on guides about partnerships, Brotherhood cosmetics, and co-op fashion or housing progression.

label: Jade Fish
description: Universal activity currency with a high weekly cap, earned from exploration, quests, enemies, chests, and activities. Spent in the Activity / Season shops on Internal Arts, gear, and cosmetics.
ui_usage_notes: Use for sections about Activity/Season Shop priorities, weekly caps, and general "play anything" income.

label: Sin Leaf
description: Special currency obtained in places like Perception Forest and used in the Sin Leaf Exchange for certain free-to-play cosmetics and accessories (for example the Yaksha outfit set and some accessories).
ui_usage_notes: Use when a cosmetic specifically lists the Sin Leaf Exchange as its source; separates it from Jade or draw-based unlocks.

label: Sound Jade
description: High-end draw-shop currency primarily obtained by exchanging Harmonic Cores (for example 1 Core → 5 Sound Jade). Used to buy legendary skill visual effects and other premium cosmetics in the Draw Shop.
ui_usage_notes: Use on advanced guides about legendary skill VFX, Mirage Boat / event items tied to the Draw Shop, and other endgame cosmetic optimizations.

label: Treasure Token
description: Guild-exclusive currency earned from guild errands and activities. Spent in guild shops on visual cosmetics and other guild-flavored rewards.
ui_usage_notes: Use when describing rewards that require being in a guild, especially Red Gold Boutique / guild cosmetic purchases.

label: Vintage Bookplate
description: Voucher currency earned by recycling unused Inner Way tips. Spent on materials and resources for upgrading Inner Ways and related systems.
ui_usage_notes: Use when explaining how to convert duplicate tips into long-term power via Inner Way upgrades and tip recycling.

label: Lingering Melody
description: Premium gacha ticket used for Celestial Echo draws (the premium banner). Commonly purchased with Echo Beads and sometimes obtained from passes or bundles.
ui_usage_notes: Use whenever a guide or checklist refers to Celestial Echo pulls, premium draws, or advises players how to spend real-money currency efficiently.

label: Resonating Melody
description: Standard gacha ticket used for Solemn Echo draws (the regular / free banner). Primarily bought with Echo Jade and earned via gameplay, events, and redemption codes.
ui_usage_notes: Use for free or grindable gacha pulls and any advice about turning Echo Jade or codes into regular cosmetics, weapons, and other non-premium rewards.

label: Battle Pass
description: Battle Pass navigation icon leading to the season pass / battle pass progression screen.
ui_usage_notes: Use to represent the Battle Pass feature in helper UIs or links to BP-related guides.

label: Draw
description: Gacha / Draw navigation icon used to open Celestial and Solemn Echo draw menus.
ui_usage_notes: Use for anything that opens or references the draw / gacha screen.

label: Events
description: Events navigation icon for listing and managing time-limited activities and event rewards.
ui_usage_notes: Use wherever the helper links to live events, event calendars, or event-focused guides.

label: Journal
description: Journal icon representing the quest log, story progression, and in-game records.
ui_usage_notes: Use when representing the quest log / journal in the helper UI.

label: Appearance
description: Appearance / fashion menu icon for outfit, cosmetic, and style management.
ui_usage_notes: Use for any entry point that talks about appearance sets, outfits, skins, or fashion systems.

label: Bag
description: Main inventory / bag menu icon used to open the item inventory screen.
ui_usage_notes: Use when linking to anything about inventory, items, or bag management.

label: Battle Pass
description: Menu-level Battle Pass icon for accessing the season pass from the main menu.
ui_usage_notes: Use as the main menu button for BP-related helper views.

label: Compendium
description: Guide / Compendium navigation icon for encyclopedic or tutorial content.
ui_usage_notes: Use for WWM Helper sections that act as encyclopedias or multi-topic guides.

label: Develop
description: Develop menu icon for progression systems like Inner Ways, upgrades, and character development.
ui_usage_notes: Use when the helper links to Inner Ways, tips, or general power progression tools.

label: Draw
description: Menu-level Draw icon for the gacha hub from the main menu.
ui_usage_notes: Use as the main menu entry point to draw/gacha-related helper content.

label: Emotes
description: Emotes menu icon for expressions and social animations.
ui_usage_notes: Use in UI that explains or previews emotes and social expression tools.

label: Events
description: Menu-level icon for event listings and event management.
ui_usage_notes: Use as the button to open any event-focused helper view.

label: Exit
description: Exit icon usually mapped to closing menus, logging out, or leaving the game/session.
ui_usage_notes: Use for close / back / exit actions in helper UIs where you want to mimic the in-game affordance.

label: Feedback
description: Feedback icon typically used for bug reports, feedback forms, or support requests.
ui_usage_notes: Use if you add a feedback link or bug-report function to the helper.

label: Guide
description: Guide icon for tutorial, help, or guide menus.
ui_usage_notes: Use as the main “Guides” hub entry icon in the helper.

label: Guild
description: Guild navigation icon for guild management, errands, guild shop, and social structures.
ui_usage_notes: Use for anything that is clearly guild-only (errands, shops, guild events).

label: Menu
description: Generic main menu icon, often used as a hub opening all other menus.
ui_usage_notes: Use as a generic hamburger/hub menu icon in your helper layout.

label: Journal
description: Menu-level icon for the quest journal and story log.
ui_usage_notes: Use when linking directly to quest log / narrative tracking features.

label: Letter
description: Letter / mail icon for in-game mail, system messages, and rewards.
ui_usage_notes: Use for mail / notification views or reward-collection screens.

label: Photo
description: Photo / camera icon for snapshot or screenshot-related features.
ui_usage_notes: Use wherever you reference in-game photos, galleries, or captures.

label: Profession
description: Profession icon for life-skills, careers, and non-combat activities.
ui_usage_notes: Use for crafting, professions, or life-skill dashboards.

label: Quest
description: Quest navigation icon for main, side, and daily quests.
ui_usage_notes: Use for quest lists, filters, or quest-helper features.

label: Season
description: Season menu icon for seasonal activities, shops, and seasonal progression.
ui_usage_notes: Use in season-path guides, season currency dashboards, and season timers.

label: Sects
description: Sects navigation icon for sect selection, progression, and sect-specific systems.
ui_usage_notes: Use for sect comparison tools, guides, or anything related to sect choices.

label: Settings
description: Settings / options icon for gameplay, graphics, and account options.
ui_usage_notes: Use anywhere that opens configuration, toggles, or preferences.

label: Shop
description: Shop icon for general in-game shops and purchases.
ui_usage_notes: Use for generic shop-related helper sections, not for a specific currency-only store.

label: Social
description: Social menu icon for friends, teams, partnerships, and other social systems.
ui_usage_notes: Use for any helper view focused on social / party / partnership systems.

label: Time
description: Time icon used for reset timers, schedule views, or calendar-style UIs.
ui_usage_notes: Use for daily/weekly reset panels, timer dashboards, or schedule helpers.

label: Wandering Paths
description: Wandering Paths navigation icon for co-op path content and social adventures.
ui_usage_notes: Use when linking to Wandering Paths explanations, co-op path guides, or adventure-slip farming routes.

label: Online Mode
description: Online Mode icon for switching the game into shared-world MMO mode where other players are visible.
ui_usage_notes: Use in helper UIs that talk about toggling between Solo and Online modes, or when describing online-only activities.

label: Shop
description: Generic shop icon typically used for quick-access shops or featured store entries.
ui_usage_notes: Use for quick shop shortcuts or non-menu-bar shop buttons.

label: Solo Mode
description: Solo Mode icon for switching into an isolated / non-shared world experience.
ui_usage_notes: Use wherever you talk about Solo vs Online modes or single-player-only activities.

label: Bamboocut – Wind Path
description: Assassin-style martial path focused on high-speed melee burst, often pairing Infernal Twinblades and Mortal Rope Dart. Leans towards PvP-style aggressive gameplay.
ui_usage_notes: Use on guides about burst / assassin builds, especially when recommending Bamboocut – Wind for aggressive players.

label: Bellstrike – Splendor Path
description: Mobile hybrid DPS path for Nameless Sword + Nameless Spear. Mixes melee combos and ranged attacks with strong repositioning and combo flow.
ui_usage_notes: Use when talking about Bellstrike Splendor breakthrough, related tips, or path-progression advice for Nameless Sword builds.

label: Bellstrike – Umbra Path
description: Bleed-centric melee DPS path often pairing Strategic Sword with Heavenquaker Spear. Focuses on stacking bleed marks and detonating them for huge burst damage.
ui_usage_notes: Use in high-damage bleed-stacking build writeups or when illustrating Bellstrike – Umbra meta combos.

label: Silkbind – Deluge Path
description: Ranged healer/support path focused on sustain and revives, typically using Soulshade Umbrella + Panacea Fan. Excels in co-op content and keeping teams alive.
ui_usage_notes: Use for healing-oriented build sections, co-op support recommendations, or Path Guide content about Silkbind – Deluge.

label: Silkbind – Jade Path
description: Ranged crowd-control path using Vernal Umbrella + Inkwell Fan. Specializes in juggling humanoid enemies and controlling fights from a distance.
ui_usage_notes: Use when describing CC-heavy ranged playstyles or stylish control builds for solo and group play.

label: Stonesplit – Might Path
description: Tank-oriented path focusing on damage mitigation and control, commonly using Thundercry Blade with Stormbreaker Spear. Designed to absorb damage and hold aggro.
ui_usage_notes: Use when explaining tank builds, group front-line roles, or Stonesplit – Might progression tips.

label: Energy
description: Account-wide activity resource that gates certain high-value tasks (similar to stamina systems in other online games). Regenerates over time and is spent on repeatable, reward-heavy content.
ui_usage_notes: Use wherever the helper references daily/weekly energy spending priorities, capped-content planning, or reminders to avoid wasting Energy at cap.

label: Stamina
description: Character-level resource used for movement, dodging, climbing, and some combat actions. Depletes quickly during intense movement or repeated dodges.
ui_usage_notes: Use for movement/combat tips, especially when talking about sprinting, parkour, or dodge management.
